title: GeolocationCoordinates: longitude property
summary:
The GeolocationCoordinates interface's read-only longitude property is a number which represents the longitude of a geographical position, specified in decimal degrees.
  Together with a timestamp, given as Unix time in milliseconds, indicating a time of measurement, the GeolocationCoordinates object is part of the GeolocationPosition interface, which is the object type returned by Geolocation API functions that obtain and return a geographical position.
pageTitle: GeolocationCoordinates: longitude property - Web APIs | MDN
